intro: Hesperis attenuatus, commonly known as the slender whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Hesperis attenuatus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain ecological communities.
